definition: tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies

sentences.english: In the following practice, abstract art and figural art become a "convenient saying ".
sentences.chinese: 在今后的实践中，“抽象和具象”就成了“方便说”。

sentences.english: They made this abstract sentimental experience vivid by depicting some images in their works.
sentences.chinese: 他们在创作中用形象将这种抽象情感体验具象化。

sentences.english: A resource enables the retrieval and manipulation of data through one of its many representations.
sentences.chinese: 资源允许通过它的许多具象之一获取和操纵数据。

sentences.english: The latest album of Li Jianhong, "The Brief History of Time" is released by Post-concrete Records, U. S.
sentences.chinese: 李剑鸿最新专辑《时间简史》由美国厂牌后具象发行。

sentences.english: Folk dragon dance has been part of the dragon culture in China for quite a long history.
sentences.chinese: 民俗舞龙作为龙文化下的具象之一，源远流长。

sentences.english: Ernst Gombrich claims to offer a general theory of the development of figurative art.
sentences.chinese: 宫布理希宣称提供一个具象艺术发展的普遍理论。

sentences.english: There could also be multiple representations of the same resource.
sentences.chinese: 同一资源还可以有多个具象。

sentences.english: The two countries'idiom-adages both have concretion and pay attention to emotional description.
sentences.chinese: 两国的成语谚语都具有具象性，重情感描述。

sentences.english: This concept is called representational state transfer.

definition: to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
the objective world (as opposed to empirical observation)
